unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically reflect on relevant contemporary societal issues and how these may impact on children's learning opportunities.
Articulate an understanding of the major theoretical developments in outdoor learning environments.
Consider social, cultural and educational diversity when planning for and evaluating outdoor learning environments for children aged birth to five years.
Understand how outdoor environments can foster holistic learning outcomes as specified in the Early Years Learning Framework.
Draw on contemporary theoretical and curriculum approaches to critically evaluate outdoor environments.
Articulate a range of intentional teaching strategies which can enhance children's learning in outdoor environments.
Design rich, integrated and inclusive outdoor play experiences for children aged birth to five.

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including (ECH113 or ECHE1130 or ABEC120) and (ECH130 or ECHE1300)

assessments.description: Diagram plus 1900 word rationale and analysis of learning
Essay (1000 words) and planning for sustainability (2 pages).
750 word professional policy outlining approach to outdoor learning

data.subject_search_title: ECHE3100 - Play-based Curriculum: Discovery and Creativity in Outdoor Environments
data.description: This unit examines the role of outdoor environments in providing opportunities for young children to engage in discovery and creative play and physical activity. The unit builds on students' foundational understanding of play-based pedagogies to enhance their capacity to recognise, evaluate and design play-based environments and experiences that promote learning for children from birth to school age. The unit explores inter-relationships between affordances in the outdoor environment, children's play behaviours and their learning, with a particular emphasis on relationship-based learning, scientific inquiry, problem-solving and physical activity. The unit requires students to engage critically with a range of relevant contemporary issues which have the potential to impact on children's opportunities for learning and development. Students also consider issues of inclusive practice for children with different educational and developmental capabilities and with different social and cultural backgrounds.
